key_points: Union County residents have until January 5, 2022, to apply for individual assistance from FEMA due to Hurricane Ida.
The FEMA Disaster Recovery Center in Union County will stay open for in-person assistance indefinitely.
Commissioner Board Chairman Alexander Mirabella emphasized the extension's importance for providing federal assistance.
The FEMA Disaster Recovery Center is located at the O’Donnell Dempsey Senior Community Center in Elizabeth, NJ.
Operating hours for the center are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., and Saturdays, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
Federal disaster assistance might include financial aid for rent, essential home repairs, and other needs not covered by insurance.
Applications for disaster assistance can be submitted online, via the FEMA app, or by calling the FEMA Helpline.
Free legal services are provided for Union County residents facing legal issues related to Hurricane Ida.
Legal assistance covers benefits, insurance claims, document replacement, and counseling on financial issues.
Union County is among 12 NJ counties designated for FEMA disaster relief following the impacts of Hurricane Ida.
